name: SendGridEmail
description: Visual Studio Team Services task for sending emails using SendGrid from build/release definitions
author: Kasun Kodagoda

inputs.name: SendGridApiKey
inputs.label: SendGrid API Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: API Key given by SendGrid. You can generate an API Key from the [SendGrid Portal](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/api_keys)

inputs.name: FromAddress
inputs.label: Sender Email Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: Email address of the sender. The value can either be only the *Email Address* _(Eg. john@example.com)_ or the *Name* and the *Email Address* _(Eg. John Smith <john@example.com>)_

inputs.name: ToAddresses
inputs.label: Recipient Email Addresses
inputs.helpMarkDown: Email address(s) of the recipient(s). Use a comma (,) separated list if you have multiple email addresses. _(Eg. john@example.com, bob@example.com)_. The email addresses can either be only the *Email Address* _(Eg. john@example.com)_ or the *Name* and the *Email Address* _(Eg. John Smith <john@example.com>)_

inputs.name: EmailBody
inputs.label: Email Body
inputs.helpMarkDown: Contents of the email you want to send.To send HTML body add the HTML here and set the _Send as HTML_ checkbox.

inputs.name: SendAsHTML
inputs.label: Send as HTML
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this option if you want to send the contents of the email body as HTML.
